editor.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the person who is in charge of a newspaper or magazine, or part of a newspaper or magazine, and decides what should be included in it
editor.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: the editor of the Daily Telegraph
editor.translation[0].definitions[1].def: someone who prepares a book or article for printing by deciding what to include and checking for any mistakes
editor.translation[0].definitions[2].def: someone who chooses what to include in a book on a particular subject
editor.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: the editor of a book of essays on modern poetry
editor.translation[0].definitions[3].def: someone who prepares a film, television programme, or sound recording for broadcasting by deciding what to include and checking for any mistakes
editor.translation[0].definitions[4].def: someone who reports on a particular subject for a radio or television news programme
editor.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: Here is John Simmonds, our Diplomatic Editor, with the latest news.
editor.translation[0].definitions[5].def: a computer program that allows you to make changes to saved information
editor.translation[1].definitions[0].def: the person who has responsibility for deciding what should be included in a newspaper or magazine
editor.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Lawson had seen many financial scandals when working as a City Editor.
the foreign editor of the New York Herald Tribune
the Deputy Editor of the Arab Observer
editor.translation[1].definitions[1].def: a person who prepares a book for printing or a film for broadcasting by checking it and making changes to improve it
editor.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: She is an editor for a small publisher in Oxford.
editor.translation[1].definitions[2].def: a computer program that allows you to make changes to a piece of writing. An editor only allows you to change the writing in a document, not the way in which the writing will appear on the page when it is printed out
